TopicTitle: Revert flight slaps me in the face

Articles.Content:
I have been trying to learn the new flight dynamics of KSP2. They seem to be different from the original. During this process I attempted to land at the island runway, my plane impacted the ground a little too hard and it broke apart. And immediately the revert flight window pops up, stopping everything in its tracks, unlike the first game I don't get to follow the wreckage down the runway and see the subsequent explosions. I reloaded and tried again, and this time I did better but the game disagreed. This time I scraped my tail and my engine came off and WHAM! A revert flight window appeared and I watched as my helpless pilot in a plane with one working engine hurled down the runway  out of control and then died. Why? I could have saved her? She didn't need to die. I have landed planes in KSP with far worse damage and was able to recover. I did this a few more times, but I couldn't get it and each time that window appeared with that little kerbal telling me “that was ugly” and I should go do some training.  And I would watch that poor kerbal fly across the runway and explode. Eventually I couldn't do it anymore, the game beat me and now I'm here. 

I hope this can be fixed by someone telling me of a setting I can change or until it is fixed in an update.

TL;DR :  The revert to flight window likes to taunt me with the lives of my pilots by appearing at the slightest hint of failure. I'm going to go play KSP OG for a while.
